pages.content: Ula| is a| green frog.| He lives in| a wooden| house| by a small| pond.

One day,| a brown seed,| from nowhere,| fell out| in front of| Ula’s house.| Ula was| extremely| curious;| he wanted| to know what| plant the seed would| become.| He put| the small seed| in his| backpack| and started| his journey| to find| the answer.
Ula| walked| through| the green| grass,| feeling| the soft soil| under| his feet.| Ula saw| Earthworm| plowing| the soil up.

Ula| asked,| "Earthworm,| do you| know| what| this seed| is called?"|
Earthworm| said,| "I don't| know,| Frog.| You |have to| sow| the seeds| and wait for| the sprout| to come out.”

Ula| thought:| "It's| too early| to plant| a tree,| maybe| someone| will know.”|
Ula said| goodbye to| Earthworm.| Earthworm| gave Ula| some soil| to put in| his pocket| to keep| the seed| from| moving| around.
Ula| continued| his journey.| He went| through| blue lakes.| The wind,| blowing| in Ula's face,| brought| cool air.| Ula saw| Goldfish| swimming| around.

Ula asked,| "Goldfish,| do you| know| what| this seed| is called?"|
Goldfish| said,| "I don't| know,| Frog.| You| have to| sow| the seeds| and wait for| the sprout| to come out.”

Ula| said,| "It's still| early| to plant| a tree,| maybe| someone| will know."|
Ula| said goodbye| to Goldfish.|  Goldfish| presented| Ula| with some| water| in the bag| to prevent| the seeds| from| drying out.
Ula| continued| his journey.| He passed| through| beautiful| green forests| with bright| yellow sunlight.| Ula saw| Sparrow| flying| around.

Ula| asked,| “Sparrow, |do you| know what| this seed| is called?"|
Smiling,| Sparrow said:| "I don't| know,| Frog.| You| have to| sow| the seed| on the ground| and| wait for| the sprout| to come out.”

Again,| Ula| thought:| "There's| still plenty| of time,| maybe| someone| will let me| know."|
Ula| said goodbye| to Sparrow.| Sparrow| advised| Ula| to open| the bag| so that| the seeds| get some| air and| sunlight.

Ula| carried on| with| his journey.| One day,| he suddenly| found| his bag| so heavy.| Oh,| thanks to| nutrients| from| the soil,| water,| and sunlight,| the brown seed| sprouted| and became| a plant.| Ula| felt happy| when he| realized it| was a| lovely| bean plant.
Ula| went| back to| his wooden| house| next to| the small| pond and| planted| the bean| plant| on the ground.| Every day,| Ula| took bean| leaves to| make boats,| sailing| on the| peaceful| pond.
